column4: it did take some getting used to, but I don't think I would be able to use anything else now.
I do not feel as if I have any lack of control.
there are some applications that do not display all that well with ion3, but there are not many that I use.
dialog boxes generally stretch the entire width of the screen, but it doesn't do any harm.
you *can* have floating windows if you want to.
I generally use it for terminal 'stuff' and sometimes writing code.
but that isn't really specific to ion3.. it just becomes all that much more useful on ion3.
I feel that I can navigate from one application to the next much more quickly.
ion3? is ubuntu even allowed to package that?
ubuntu isn't really among the distros that there was a problem with.. I believe it was mostly arch linux.
oh, that must be a fork from before tuomov went insane
that could be.. but I don't think so.
I was sure tuomov had decided to start charging or something for ion
I'm pretty sure I still have to accept a disclaimer that hands my soul over to tuomov :p
